title: Yen Hits New 20-Year Low After Bank of Japan Reinforces Low-Rate Policy
sub_head: Central bank Gov. Kuroda, bucking U.S. trend, says he is ‘patiently continuing monetary easing’
body:
TOKYO—The yen weakened to more than 130 to the dollar on Thursday for the first time since April 2002, after the Bank of Japan reinforced its commitment to low interest rates despite rising inflation.
“While central banks in the U.S. and Europe are moving toward monetary tightening or rate increases, the Japanese economy is still on the road to recovery from the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic,” BOJ Gov. Haruhiko Kuroda said at a news conference. “It is most important to support economic recovery by patiently continuing monetary easing.”
